29#ifndef OT_LAYOUT_COMMON_RANGERECORD_HH
30#define OT_LAYOUT_COMMON_RANGERECORD_HH
31
32namespace OT {
33namespace Layout {
34namespace Common {
35
36template <typename Types>
37struct RangeRecord
38{
39 typename Types::HBGlyphID first; /* First GlyphID in the range */
40 typename Types::HBGlyphID last; /* Last GlyphID in the range */
41 HBUINT16 value; /* Value */
42
43 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (2 + 2 * Types::size);
44
45 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
46 {
47 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
48 return_trace (c->check_struct (this));
49 }
50
51 int cmp (hb_codepoint_t g) const
52 { return g < first ? -1 : g <= last ? 0 : +1; }
53
54 unsigned get_population () const
55 {
56 if (unlikely (last < first)) return 0;
57 return (last - first + 1);
58 }
59
60 bool intersects (const hb_set_t &glyphs) const
61 { return glyphs.intersects (first, last); }
62
63 template <typename set_t>
64 bool collect_coverage (set_t *glyphs) const
65 { return glyphs->add_range (first, last); }
66};
67
68}
69}
70}
71
72// TODO(garretrieger): This was previously implemented using
73// DECLARE_NULL_NAMESPACE_BYTES_TEMPLATE1 (OT, RangeRecord, 9);
74// but that only works when there is only a single namespace level.
75// The macro should probably be fixed so it can work in this situation.
76extern HB_INTERNAL const unsigned char _hb_Null_OT_RangeRecord[9];
77template <typename Spec>
78struct Null<OT::Layout::Common::RangeRecord<Spec>> {
79 static OT::Layout::Common::RangeRecord<Spec> const & get_null () {
80 return *reinterpret_cast<const OT::Layout::Common::RangeRecord<Spec> *> (_hb_Null_OT_RangeRecord);
81 }
82};
83
84
85#endif // #ifndef OT_LAYOUT_COMMON_RANGERECORD_HH
86
